message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DS 

The paper deals with learning in a noisy bisection model, which is a problem in machine learning. The use of Bayesian algorithms and the focus on convergence and expected performance suggest that the paper belongs to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also deals with stochastic signals and convergence, which are topics in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The use of information theory and the study of noisy signals suggest that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The study of convergence and performance in a noisy environment also suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY). Finally, the use of algorithms and the study of convergence suggest that the paper could belong to the sub-category of Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS).
